intro: Jonesiopsis radialis, commonly known as the radiate jonesiopsis, is a rare and little-studied plant belonging to the family Arecaceae, or palms. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and a crown of feathery, pinnate leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces dark, round berries as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Jonesiopsis radialis is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
